message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.RO, cs.SY, cs.CV 

This paper is about deep reinforcement learning, which is a subfield of machine learning and artificial intelligence. The paper specifically focuses on curriculum learning, which is a technique for training machine learning models by gradually increasing the difficulty of the tasks they are asked to perform. This topic is closely related to several sub-categories of computer science, including machine learning (cs.LG), artificial intelligence (cs.AI), robotics (cs.RO), systems and control (cs.SY), and computer vision (cs.CV). Given the focus on deep reinforcement learning and curriculum learning, cs.LG and cs.AI are the most likely sub-categories. However, the use of the Reacher environment and the focus on learning efficiency suggest that cs.RO and cs.SY are also relevant. Finally, the potential applications of the technique to computer vision tasks suggest that cs.CV may also be relevant.
